marks: [ほのぼのとあかし野浦の朝霧にしまがくれ行くふねをしぞおもふ] {Honobono to/ Akas [春信画] {Harunobu ga}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text:
Kakinomoto Hitomaro (died 708) is venerated by the Japanese as one of their earliest poets. The inscribed poem is taken from the anthology "<I>Kokin Wakashu_<I> (Collection of Japanese Poems of Ancient and Modern Times)" from c. 905.

<I>Into the mist, glowing with dawn
across the Bay of Akashi
a boat carries my thoughts
into hiding
islands beyond<I>

(transl. Lewis Cook)
title: Poem by Kakinomoto Hitomaro
